Reviews.Title: It's not a smartphone-- You knew that when you bought it
Reviews.Author: R. Smuck
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone since April 2011 and I really like it. I wanted a touch screen that wasn't a smartphone and that's exactly what the Pantech Crux is. The battery is good (I can go about 1.5-2 days without charging. In this day of smart phones that have to be charged every night/throughout the day, I view this as a good thing). It has a music player that is OK, but I don't like how you can't edit a playlist after you create it. The response time when you select something is a little slow, but everything works. The texting is frustrating sometimes because it CAN be inaccurate, but THIS IS NOT A SMARTPHONE, so what were you expecting?If you have patience and don't care about having a smartphone, this phone is good. I actually destroyed my first Pantech Crux on a treadmill and requested that it be replaced by the same phone--that's how much I like it.

Reviews.Title: She Love's It
Reviews.Author: korhayus
Reviews.Content: I bought a used version of this phone for my girlfriend as a replacement for a similar phone that was on it's last leg.(It was given to her used) The condition is great, no screen scratch's or imperfections anywhere to be seen. Anywho, she is in love with this phone, the dealer we bought it from was great, it was packaged rather well. Everything was secure and not flopping around in the box etc.  If you want a cool touch phone experience, this is it.  It's not a smart phone either, so you dont have to worry about any data plan's etc.  Overall its a rather nice phone, very easy to use and setup etc.  It's not too large either which is very nice now a day's considering smart phones are like huge. Lol.

Reviews.Title: Satisified
Reviews.Author: Cautious
Reviews.Content: Real good product, it was what I wanted and havent put it down yet. I'm actually using it at this very moment!

Reviews.Title: not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Chalyn
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because my old phone sucked from verizon.  This phone is very annoying because the button you push when you are texting does not come out to be the right letter.  Texting is very hard and the messages do not go through 60% of the time.  The mailbox for voice mails is annoying too because you do not have much storage space on there so you constantly have to delete them.  They do not hold a lot of pictures and you can not zoom in. The camera is very unclear....this phone sucks

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: This is the best phone.  I had one before and it was stolen so i am extremely happy that I got a replacement one!

Reviews.Title: Pantech Crux
Reviews.Author: Cassidy
Reviews.Content: This is actually not to bad of a little phone. My fiance needed a new phone we got him this one and he likes it. The way the screen moves down for locking the phone is really handy, definitely a recommended phone.

Reviews.Title: love it!!
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: the pantech cruz is a great phone. i love it. i have had it for a year and a half now and never had any problems. but i lost it and i was very upset but i am ordering a new one. its not a smartphone and that's okay  because i don't need one. i would recommend this phone. it's great!

Reviews.Title: Great phone! Very sturdy.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received the Pantech Crux in 2011. Since then it has been dropped, scraped across cement sidewalks and at the mercy of a four year olds hands. This phone has held up like a champ. In the last 5 months the coating has been coming off from the top. The touch screen is not sensitive. I as well had to turn phone off and remove battery to get texts. I do like the texting on this phone. If you are getting this phone for calling/texting, its great. I do not use the internet, but it does have the ability to use it. It is not a smart phone. The ringtones, if you want custom have to be shorter than 30 seconds. Also to get songs into ringtones seems a bit time consuming and backwards. The speaker quality is fantastic.Overall, this phone is a great for a teenager or just all around cheaper option than what is on the market. Great texting/calling.

Reviews.Title: Crux is ok...bought another one
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: this is the second of these phones. first one got wet. texting, especially in T9 takes time for the phone to know how you talk, lots of drop down menus to choose your word from. that gets annoying but the more you text ...the less they pop up. For those out there who don't want to use a smart phone yet...this is the next best thing. I have noticed among Crux users that they are all a little different...some slide really easy, while others are slightly stiff. I don't mind the stiff sliding ones because then it doesn't accidently slide up and call someone or start randomly start playing your music. we've had ours for two years and more and have not upgraded yet. no rush.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: sean barber
Reviews.Content: got this for my 13 yr old son wanted a touch screen he loves it and i like it becouse its not a smart phone to run my bill up

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Tobydea
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Crux that my son has had. The first one lasted him 3 years. He is only 13 and his phone gets dropped a lot, so I thought that was a long time! He needed a new phone and wanted the same one because he loved it so much. He never has any complications with it. Very happy with this phone.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this phone.
Reviews.Author: Mitch
Reviews.Content: Not even entirely sure where to start with this phone, but it is by far the worst phone I have ever owned.First of all, being entirely touch screen, one would expect that the touch screen would work well, or at least decently--this is not the case. The calibration gets thrown off so easily and it is very laggy when texting. What's worse, often I will not receive texts for half an hour to an hour after they have been sent (sometimes up to 2 hours), despite having excellent signal. An even worse case scenario of this is when the phone decides to do it's little bi-weekly "general failure" charade, in which it does not send or receive messages AT ALL. The phone gives no indication that it has gone into general failure, so the only way to find out is when you happen to text someone and the message cannot be sent. All the while, other people may have been trying to contact you or to respond to messages. The only remedy I found for this was to turn the phone off and on (a process that also takes forever and a day), after which I'm usually greeted with a barrage of text messages.Further related to the core necessities of the phone is the call quality. It's terrible; I often find myself asking people to repeat what they said multiple times or shouting to get my message through clearly.As if having poor core functions of the phone wasn't bad enough, the extra "features" are more of a bother than a bonus. The camera isn't that great, even though I expected that from the start. The phone in general is sluggish, at best. Tapping any application on the home screen requires at least some wait for a response. When opening the text history from a contact, the wait time is unacceptably long for contacts that have ~30+ messages stored. Simply opening my pictures appears to take all the processing power that the phone can muster, and I usually have to wait a minute or two for them all to load. I occasionally have problems with the alarm feature of the phone, in that it fails to go off. This is very inconvenient when the  phone is the only alarm I rely on.I also occasionally experience very bizarre battery performance. After charging it, there will be times when the battery will be completely dead within the hour. Removing the battery and placing it back in followed by another recharge seems to fix this, at least temporarily.Cosmetically, the phone screen is very hard to see in direct or even partial light.The only positive things I can think of about the phone is that it has a decent music player and that the battery life isn't terrible, even after two years (with the exception of the problem mentioned above). Having used it only as a basic phone, I can not speak for its 3G and related functions, but I always seemed to have decent coverage. Though, truly, if you want the 3G features, you would be better off with a smart phone.Overall, I would buy any phone before purchasing this one again. It is very unreliable and frustrating to use, even for someone who is usually patient with electronics.

Reviews.Title: Crap
Reviews.Author: owner
Reviews.Content: This phone is the most awful phone that I have ever owned.  The touch needs to be calibrated.  The battery life is awful.  I have had the phone since Christmas of 2011 and I have had to charge it everyday.  It's awful, don't waste you time with it.

Reviews.Title: I feel like I'm carrying around a child's play phone
Reviews.Author: ChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: I'm stuck on my parent's contract. They keep going to Verizon last minute or out of nowhere deciding they have found a "good deal" and get new phones. This often results in them renewing their contracts and the cycle begins all over again. I don't want to sound like I'm complaining, it's nice of them to keep me on their plan (one less bill for me) but I wish they would consult me before hand.So, with that in mind: I get a random phone call to come to the local Target. They're talking to a Verizon sales person and are getting new phones. I rush over there and I'm given two options. A brick of a flip phone..or the Pantech Crux.  I foolishly selected the Pantech Crux. Had I more time to research this phone, I would have opted for two tin cans with a string between them.I realize it's not a smartphone. That's okay. I don't need a smartphone (although it would be nice). I do however need a phone that doesn't randomly turn off and back on. I need a phone that will hold a charge for more than a day. I need a phone that I can actually send and receive texts from. I need a phone that I can actually read the screen OUTDOORS (doesn't matter if your in shade or an apocalypse storm is coming..you can't see the damn screen). I need a phone that after programming an alarm, the alarm will go off at said time.  The simplest task like selecting a contact turns into an ordeal. God help you if you accidentally hit the icon for an app. 3 hours later you can back out of it and return to the home screen.  Sometimes I feel I'm just walking around with a child's play phone. Who am I kidding? Kids today have better play phones than this.

Reviews.Title: Great cell
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: This was a great purchase for my 13 yr old son. He does not need a data plan the phone was for mostly text and calls. So it was perfect! Came fast and was easy to set up!

Reviews.Title: New?? I don't think so!
Reviews.Author: michael maloy
Reviews.Content: The item description said "New" if that was the case then the piece at the top of the phone would not be coming off. If I wanted a used phone I would have bought one. Will not be ordering from this company in the future. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Decent Phone
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I've had the Pantech Crux for more than two years and the phone has its flaws.1. I had to turn my phone on and off to receive text and picture messages.2. I was given a MicroSD card and the card never fit into the slot. It always popped out and never was secure. (Yes, I was given the correct card).3. Touchscreen isn't sensitive. I would hit "abc" to get the letter "A" and yet the letter "D" appears.4. Battery life doesn't last that long. On a six-hour trip, my battery level was already down to three bars.Pro's1. The SRS WOW HD sound in music only mode is very good. Music sounds awesome. Easy one-touch music functions. (Play button is on top of phone in between the seek buttons)2. Camera is pretty decent. No flash or zoom but the pictures are decent. Video has zoom and records in 640X480 resolution.Overall I just use the phone to make calls and text. I don't have data, so I don't use the apps it comes with. The Pantech Crux did what I needed it to, make calls and text with some minor flaws. Decent phone.

Reviews.Title: Pantech Crux
Reviews.Author: Emily Rodgers
Reviews.Content: One of the things the phone doesn't do good is stay speedy. Adults & teenagers are user of this product. This phone is good for mp3's, & searching the web.

Reviews.Title: this is by far the absolute WORST phone I have EVER had, EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: yafa dacosta
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone I have EVER had in my entire phone owning life. The very minute, and I'm serious, the very minute my contract ended i was on the phone with verizon ordering an iphone.unless you are a glutton for punishment stay away, stay far FAR, FAR FAR away!There is NOTHING good about this phone, NOTHING!Run, don't Walk!

Reviews.Title: Kids Love it!
Reviews.Author: Ms Lisa
Reviews.Content: We ordered this last year and it is now been passed down to the second child.  They love the touch screen and it has proven to be a pretty durable little phone.  The battery life is also quite good.

Reviews.Title: Pantech Crux
Reviews.Author: D Reed
Reviews.Content: I am extremly happy with my Pantech Crux.  It is very simple to use.  I would consider ordering another one for a second line.  My amazon experience seem to deliver what it says. I recommend the Pantech Crux.

Reviews.Title: Phone
Reviews.Author: Keri
Reviews.Content: The phone stopped working after having it for one week.  I sent it back to the store that i purchased it from.  I am hopeing that their return policy and customer service is as great as their initial service was.

Reviews.Title: I'm a teenager and this phone sucks
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I got this phone from Verizon about two years ago. I hate putting up with this phone, it feels like a chore to have it rather than a privilege. I read the reviews on Verizon's website and on amazon, I saw that this phone had some really nasty reviews about how the touch screen and camera do not hardly work; I just brushed it off and thought "maybe it's just old people who cant work a touch phone and it wont happen to me" I was so wrong. When I got the phone I was super excited because I had just switched from the LG enV3 and I finally had a touch screen phone. I thought it might have been just me when the screen was sort of inaccurate, but it wasnt just me. The screen messes up a lot and just regularly it is very inaccurate. Next, the missed calls feature on the phone doesnt allow you to see your recent or missed calls because the phone cuts off every single time you try to look at the calls. The music buttons are on the top of the phone which I thought would be a cool feature quickly backfired, I have gotten my phone taken away in school so many times because my jeans pressed the buttons and music played loudly. The camera doesnt have a zoom feature and it gives all the pictures a bad photoshoped look.I WAS NOT SMART ENOUGH TO LISTEN TO THE BAD REVIEWS PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT GET THIS PHONE. IM BEGGING YOU. I WOULDNT WISH THIS PHONE ON MY WORST ENEMY, AND THATS NOT AN EXAGGERATION.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Justin Bretz
Reviews.Content: Very good product. Exactly how described. Even arrived early which was a very nice surprise. Very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Emma O'Connell
Reviews.Content: I only got as a replacement phone until I get a new one so for the time being its awesome. But if I had to have it any longer I'd probably go insane. It's a very frustrating phone to operate.

Reviews.Title: Horrible phone
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I have hated this phone from day one.  Horrible touch screen lag, you have to hit the screen multiple times to get it to work. Camera on phone takes a decent picture.

Reviews.Title: THE WORST PHONE EVER
Reviews.Author: alyson
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this phone.  i am on my third one.  i got it through verizon and i cant change out because i used it as my upgrade.  screen freezes, it shuts off whenever it wants, and sometimes it doesnt give caller id.  poor design. worst phone i have ever had.

Reviews.Title: Not the best phone.
Reviews.Author: liveandinspired
Reviews.Content: So I wanted this phone because it was different. & at first, I really liked it. But on the second day of having it, it would receive a text message twice, or it wouldn't receive it at all, because people would text me & says "Hey are you there?" when I thought I was waiting for them to reply. It unlocks way too easy, but I guess I should have expected that. The keyboard is good except for when it decides to lag. Pictures are decent, too.

Reviews.Title: Initial response - I Like this phone!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gene B.
Reviews.Content: Sleek, compact and quality feel. Wanted something sleeker than my LG Slider, chose this Refurbished unit.  Item looks like New, no real noticeable scratches.  came with original Box,Instructions and A/C charger.  Great feel and relatively easy to set-up.  Big improvement over my "Slider", plus I did not have to "Upgrade" to the DATA Package Verizon requires for most, if not all, of their newer/more modern styled mobile phones.  I just activated it online today and all went well.  So far - So Good!!!  Ordered earlier this week, got it on Friday, wasn't expected until mid to end of following week - "Darn Quick and Efficient Process", I must say.  Overall, "Impressed with Product and supplier.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: nice phone
Reviews.Author: heatherleigh228
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my son because he wanted a touch screen but not a smart phone. I was amazed at how fast I received it and it was so easy to set up. My son just loves this phone. He can't put it down.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: K. L. Thompson
Reviews.Content: If you read the description, you will see that the phone is not a Smart Phone and it does not come with a book. The phone was in great condition and works GREAT. I ordered this for a friend and she loves it. Came exactly as said in the listing. It also said it may have scratches and it we could find none. Love it!

Reviews.Title: A good phone
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: This phone came quick and works very well. Does not need the web plan to go online so no need to pay extra. Its no iphone but is a great touch screen.

Reviews.Title: alright of a phone
Reviews.Author: beekay11
Reviews.Content: its an okay phone, It just doesn't fit my style for a phone I would like. If you like the full touch screen and are a slower texter then I would recommend this phone. If all you do is text, this phone is not for you.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: E. Davis "ELdavis_1"
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because I'm on my parent's plan still and my mom wanted me to upgrade phone's after my two-year contract was up. Not having any money, I chose the only free phone they had, and after having it for about a year and a half, all I can say is that it is worthless. The touchscreen is very unresponsive, I'm constantly locking it and unlocking it to realign the touch pad. There are three buttons at the top of the phone for MP3 function (because everyone uses their phones for mp3s if they don't have an iPhone or Droid, right?) that, if held down for a second or two, start to play music loudly, EVEN IF THE PHONE IS ON SILENT!!! It wouldn't be a problem, except that when I download ringtones, it decides to save a copy of them in my Music folder, and when I try to delete the copy, it takes the entire ringtone off the phone.This phone is nothing but frustrating. The next time I go to my parent's house I'm going to switch back to my old phone with actual buttons and no mp3s, until I can afford an iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Not a good choice
Reviews.Author: B. Stewart
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for close a year now and I just don't like it.  The longer I have it the less I do. Too many commands have to be made for the simplest things. I am going back to an EnV3

Reviews.Title: Don't get it.
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Owned this phone for 2 years.2 hectic years, I regret getting it.Lots of glitches.Trying to text someone? Nope you can't do that, pressing T somehow inputs M.Trying to receive a text? NOPE, no receiving texts until 6 hours - 2 days later.Random lag that lasts from 2 to 10 seconds.Almost every picture taken with the phone is corrupt, so be sure to take 5 and hope 1 of them doesn't turn out weird.Very disappointed, getting a new phone thankfully though!

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY
Reviews.Author: chelsea errington
Reviews.Content: BAD PHONE(Typing in () bc i needed 18 words atleast for a reveiw so i am writing this. K.

Reviews.Title: Phone has grown to have problems
Reviews.Author: zdicke
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone at least a year and a half now and it has grown into some major issues.First is that over time the touch screen gets off sync. With a simple movement of the physical "Slide to Lock" function to lock then unlock, it re calibrates and works great. The issue is that over time this calibration has gotten to where it becomes un-calibrated very quickly, sometimes 3-4 times in a single text message.Second, Not real sure if this is just Verizon getting screwy or the phone itself, but it will go HOURS with out receiving a single txt message. I will have to restart the phone to finally get all of the texts that have been building up, and then it shows them as "received" at their original times they should have been received, though they were not. This causes problems because there may be time sensitive messages for work or what not and I do not receive them until it is too late. I believe this is involved with the phone's standard antenna (the 1x one). Reason being, is that i will receive emails like normal during these silent periods of txting, which uses the 3G antenna.Lastly, the battery is sporadic. In the past month alone, I can have the phone go from lasting two days on a single charge to lasting 3 hours on a single charge, with the same general use in both instances (general txting and email, occasional call). I would have to say this can only be due to the phone either believing it is charged when it is not, or, the phone getting caught in programming loops that DRAIN the battery without my knowledge.I gave three stars because for the first year i had it, i loved this phone, it is just in the past 4 or so months when these issues have started to arise, and as it gets older, they are becoming more and more frequent.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: reluctant customer
Reviews.Content: Was not compliant with service, i tried to hook the phone up to a line. and after.20 minutes of trying to get the.phone to work, i found out it didn't work with Verizon.

Reviews.Title: i hate this phone!
Reviews.Author: jordan
Reviews.Content: i have had this phone for a year and i hate it! texting on it is so hard. the phone shuts off by itself. sometmes when you recieve a phone call it wont let you answer, and sometimes you cant hear them and they cant hear you! the reception is horrible! so now im in the process of looking for a new phone! i wouldnt recommend this phone to anyone!

Reviews.Title: this phone is awful!
Reviews.Author: aimonti
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for a year now. It has given me issues from the beginning. Text messages do not come through unless I reprogram the phone manually. It is such a pain! But it gets worse, recently the phone has been turning itself on and off... And it is constant! I would say it does this upwards of 25 times a day. I never dropped it or anything. It even turns off while I am in a phone call. Features aren't too great either, the inbox gets full very quickly, the touch screen is often not calibrated correctly (while texting, it is difficult to hit the letter intended) and the camera is iffy.  I am looking for a new phone immediately.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT GET THIS PHONE!
Reviews.Author: Martina
Reviews.Content: I have had mine for 1.5 years and it is horrible. I don't receive my text messages without turning the thing on and off a couple times a week, even voice mail messages. Verizon tells me that this is a problem with my number or the cell phone tower, but not other phones have this problem and my other cell phones have never had a problem like this. The internet sucks, which can be expected since this is not a smart phone, but I should be at least able to receive text and voicemail messages! So if you enjoy texting, please do not get this phone!

Reviews.Title: Not as cool as it looks.
Reviews.Author: Jen426
Reviews.Content: I thought it was awesome when I bought it, but it's not. The sliding front seems nice at first but it gets annoying-you have to put it in your pocket a certain way or it will slide. I had it for a couple months and then all of a sudden I could makes call but hear nothing-not even the dial tone. I bought it through wal mart for 97 cents-insurance wanted me to pay $45 to fix it. I decided to go back to my old phone I had before it (which is three years old and still works way better). Texting on this phone was difficult as the touch screen was not as sensitive as something like the iPhone. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: awful
Reviews.Author: mmohan
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for about 6 months and it is AWFUL. If you like to text, DO NOT GET THIS PHONE! I firmly believe this is the wost phone verizon has ever made. Take my word for it and please save yourself the trouble. When it breaks, verizon will do anything in their power to NOT fix it for you.

Verizon/ CDMA 850 / 1900
Bluetooth Supported
USB Version: 2.0 High Speed micro-USB connector
Real-Music Ringers Supported Formats: MP3, AAC, WAV
Headphone Jack (3.5mm)
ProductInfo.Name: Pantech Crux Touch Screen Cell Phone Verizon - No Contract Required - Good ESN
